bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 125 (Wednesday, July 24, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. RIGGLEMAN:H.R. 3928.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H7377]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

summary.text:
Federal Reserve Accountability and Justification Act

This bill requires the Federal Reserve Board to satisfy certain requirements prior to providing a new payment service or substantially changing existing payment services.

bill.title: Federal Reserve Accountability and Justification Act

item.title: Federal Reserve Accountability and Justification Act

To require the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve to satisfy certain requirements before providing any new payment service, or substantially changing or expanding any existing payment service, and for other purposes.
Federal Reserve Accountability and Justification Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
